entries.title: What lies ahead for the US-China relationship?
entries.description: A Chinese balloon over US skies triggers a diplomatic storm.

entries.title: East African leaders urge ceasefire in eastern DR Congo
entries.description: The call came after leaders of the East African Community held a summit in Burundi on Saturday.

entries.title: Ukraine power substation fire leaves Odesa’s grid on the brink
entries.description: Prime Minister Denys Shmyal says the 'scale of the accident is significant' after fire at an electrical substation.

entries.title: Biden says US will ‘take care of’ suspected Chinese spy balloon
entries.description: The US president's remark comes after China called for 'calm' over the balloon flying across the US.

entries.title: Japan PM dismisses aide over anti-LGBTQ+ comments
entries.description: Fumio Kishida blasts aide's comments on same sex unions as 'outrageous' and 'incompatible' with an inclusive society.

entries.title: ‘Generational’ Arctic blast hits Northeast US, Canada
entries.description: A powerful arctic blast swept into the US Northeast, Canada pushing temperatures to perilously low levels.

entries.title: Pope to meet war victims, raise plight of women in South Sudan
entries.description: Francis, who is on the first-ever papal visit to South Sudan, will minister to church personnel and war victims.

entries.title: Russia, Ukraine swap prisoners as battle for Bakhmut rages
entries.description: Russia says 63 Russian soldiers were released while Ukrainian authorities say 116 of their servicemen have been freed.

entries.title: Pakistan blocks Wikipedia citing ‘sacrilegious’ content
entries.description: Regulator says the website had until late Friday to heed its warning about 'sacrilegious content'.

entries.title: ‘Honour killing’ of YouTube star causes outrage in Iraq
entries.description: Tiba al-Ali, 22, was killed by her father, despite attempts by police to mediate a dispute between her and her family.

entries.title: Iran and the West clash over IAEA report on Fordow nuclear plant
entries.description: The latest row comes as the IAEA chief hopes for progress in a potential visit to Tehran in February.

entries.title: Palestinians wounded after Israeli forces raid camp in West Bank
entries.description: At least 13 Palestinians have been injured after Israeli forces raided the Aqbat Jabr refugee camp to arrest 10 people.

entries.title: Sri Lankans lament Independence Day pomp amid economic crisis
entries.description: Armed troops parade in Colombo amid criticim over the event's cost at a time of dire economic crisis.

entries.title: The occupation of Palestine intensifies
entries.description: Israeli media’s myopic coverage as violence spirals. Plus, the complexities and nuances of translating literary work.

entries.title: Nigeria’s Peter Obi started a movement. Can he become president?
entries.description: Obi has inspired a zealous movement of mostly youths and disrupted Nigeria's traditional two-man presidential contest.

entries.title: Kashmir is bleeding. So is its economy
entries.description: Contrary to the Indian government's claims, investments in Kashmir are down, and there's a new wave a violence.

entries.title: Should Europe’s pension schemes be reformed?
entries.description: France is among many nations struggling to keep retirement schemes afloat.

entries.title: Sixth US police officer fired over beating death of Tyre Nichols
entries.description: Five other officers had already been fired and charged with murder over Tyre Nichols' death.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 346
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 346th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Myanmar military expands martial law in strongholds of resistance
entries.description: Expansion of martial law in 37 townships indicates the military is looking for new ways to crush resistance.

entries.title: Sri Lankan FM: Bad luck and bad policies caused economic crisis
entries.description: Foreign Minister Ali Sabry discusses his country's worst financial collapse since its independence in 1948.

entries.title: Lebanon’s abandoned children are coming home
entries.description: When Sammy took a DNA test, he didn't know it would reveal he had a brother - or that he was adopted.

entries.title: Israeli forces kill unarmed Palestinian man in occupied West Bank
entries.description: Abdullah Sami Qalalweh, 26, was shot and killed near the town of Huwara, south of Nablus, officials said.

entries.title: Brazil sinks aircraft carrier in Atlantic despite pollution risk
entries.description: Critics of Brazil's planned sinking of the Sao Paulo described it as a 'state-sponsored environmental crime'.

entries.title: Ukraine will fight for Bakhmut ‘as long as we can’: Zelenskyy
entries.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has also called for Ukraine's rapid accession to the EU.

entries.title: Family of Amir Locke, shot in no-knock police raid, files lawsuit
entries.description: The 22-year-old was killed in a police shooting after officers entered the Minneapolis apartment where he was sleeping.

entries.title: More than 40 killed in Nigeria as gunmen and vigilantes clash
entries.description: Lack of security has become widespread in Nigeria and is a key concern for voters ahead of a February 25 election.

entries.title: Death toll rises as Chile reels from wildfires driven by heatwave
entries.description: Climate change has fuelled the growth of explosive wildfires across the globe with rising temperatures and drought.

entries.title: Jury clears Elon Musk of wrongdoing over 2018 Tesla tweets
entries.description: Musk was accused of deceiving investors when he tweeted he had secured enough funding to take Tesla private.

entries.title: Infographic: A global look at cancer
entries.description: In 2020, more than 18 million people around the world were diagnosed with cancer.
